p: The scavenging activity of hydroxyl radical was evaluated based on the method described by Mathew and Abraham with slight modification [ 34]. Briefly, the reaction mixture, contained different concentrations of the extract, 0.1 mM FeCl 3, 0.1 mM EDTA, 2.8 mM deoxyribose, 0.1 mM ascorbic acid, and 1 mM H 2O 2 in KH 2PO 4–KOH buffer (20 mM pH 7.4), was incubated in a water bath at 37 °C for the nonsite-specific hydroxyl radical system. After incubation of 1 h, 2.8% TCA (200 μL) and 1% TBA (200 μL) were added. After boiling at 100 °C for 30 min, the antioxidative activity of the boiled mixture was measured by calculating the decrease in absorbance measured at 532 nm by the following equation.
